clinical_study.brief_title: Cerebral Reorganization of Stroke Patients After Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation by Neuroimaging Analysis
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Cerebral Structural and Functional Reorganization of Stroke Patients After Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (rTMS) Using the Method of Neuroimaging Brain Network Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: The study aimed to figure out brain structural and functional reorganization evidence after repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation through the method of neuroimaging brain network analysis, such as resting-state functional magnetic resonance imaging and diffusion tensor imaging.

primary_outcome.measure: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline NIHSS at 1 month after real rTMS/sham rTMS
primary_outcome.description: The investigators use NIHSS to evaluate the participants' motor function.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline BI at 1 month after real rTMS/sham rTMS
primary_outcome.description: The investigators use BI to evaluate the participants' activities of daily living.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline FMA at 1 month after real rTMS/sham rTMS
primary_outcome.description: The investigators use FMA to evaluate the participants' motor function.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline FC at 1 month after real rTMS/sham rTMS
secondary_outcome.description: Functional Connectivity was examined using a seed-based voxel-wise correlation approach. The ipsilesional primary motor cortex (M1) was defined as the region of interest. Pearson's correlation analysis between the time course of the ipsilesional M1 and that of every voxel in the whole brain was computed for a map of correlation coefficients, which were Fisher's z-transformed and called as z-FC maps.

arm_group.description: The rTMS treatment group received a 10-day real repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) treatment beginning within 1 week after stroke onset.
The sham group received a 10-day sham repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) treatment beginning within 1 week after stroke onset.

intervention.description: The rTMS treatments were performed using a Medtronic MagPro type magnetic stimulation device (Medtronic, Minneapolis, MN, USA) and a figure-of-eight coil (MC-B70, Medtronic). Coils were placed tangent to the scalp. The stimulation protocol involved 50 trains of 20 pulses applied over the ipsilesional M1 at a frequency of 5 HZ, with the stimulus intensity set at 120% of the resting motor threshold of the unaffected extremity.
The sham rTMS was performed on the same site as the rTMS treatment group but without any true stimulations. Coils were placed perpendicular to the scalp.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. stroke patients within 1 week after onset with unilateral cerebral subcortex lesion in the middle cerebral artery territory detected by diffusion weighted image,
2. right-handed,
3. without memory loss or intelligence disorder,
4. never suffered stroke before.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. direct damage to the cerebral cortex,
2. a history of cerebral vessel disease,
3. tendency to hemorrhage or existed brain hemorrhage,
4. epilepsy or other mental disorders,
5. any MRI contraindications.
